item.title: Sudan’s Humanitarian Emergency
item.description: Panelists discuss the status of the conflict in Sudan, including the deteriorating condition of civilians, the prospect for regional stability, and the options for an international response.This is a virtual meeting through Zoom.Log-in information and instructions on how to participate during the question-and-answer portion will be provided the evening before the event to those who register.

item.title: The Pentagon’s AI Problem Isn’t Algorithms, It’s Evaluation
item.description: Current AI benchmarks were not designed for the realities of war. Without defense-specific evaluation, AI systems risk being deployed without evidence they improve military judgment or outcomes.

item.title: Ryan Berg in Foreign Policy: Trump’s Western Hemisphere Pivot Is Real
item.description: Americas Program Director Ryan C. Berg contends that if President Trump wants to make good on the new National Security Strategy, the United States must recalibrate its defense posture.

item.title: Improving Transparency and Human Rights in Procurement: An Incentive-Based Approach
item.description: The substantial U.S. purchasing power creates significant opportunities to foster positive change in supply chains and makes government procurement an important, and underutilized, inroad for the protection of human rights.
